Tom, should be an easy fix. The list passed into DiffRegion is changed (cleared) outside.

We have a related issue in the performance tests which are caused by the same problem: concurrent modification of DocumentLineDiffer.fDifferences.

Here's the error log from the performance tests:

...
Caused by: java.util.ConcurrentModificationException

Fixed by synchronizing on the list in the relevant positions. Note that the only places where the list is modified are:

- when the initialization job is canceled (DocumentLineDiffer::clearModel())
- when incrementally diffing (DocumentLineDiffer::handleDocumentChanged())

Fixed > 20060418
